intro: Galium podlachicum, commonly known as the Podlachian bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to eastern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that contain numerous seeds. Galium podlachicum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
